body:
ENGLISH:

Hi all. Im Yunooo,and i wish Avicus staff do an public scrimmage plugin,for practice the tournaments,do strats,defenses,etc. And try out people without inviting them to the team.
Thanks.

SPANISH:

Hola a todos,soy Yunooo,y me gustaría que el staff de Avicus haga un plugin público de Scrims,así,no tendremos que recurrir a los servidores que te da Avicus,y podremos poner los mapas que queramos y practicar strats,defensas,etc. Y probar gente sin invitarlos al equipo.
Gracias.
body_tagged:
ENGLISH:

Hi all. Im Yunooo,and i wish Avicus staff do an public scrimmage plugin,for practice the tournaments,do strats,defenses,etc. And try out people without inviting them to the team.
Thanks.

SPANISH:

Hola a todos,soy Yunooo,y me gustaría que el staff de Avicus haga un plugin público de Scrims,así,no tendremos que recurrir a los servidores que te da Avicus,y podremos poner los mapas que queramos y practicar strats,defensas,etc. Y probar gente sin invitarlos al equipo.
Gracias.
title: Make an public scrimms plugin

replies.body:
Nah. You just need to be in a team of 4+ players at http://Avicus.net/teams and either reserve a scrim server or get invited to one

This is easier tbh.
replies.body_tagged:
Nah. You just need to be in a team of 4+ players at http://Avicus.net/teams and either reserve a scrim server or get invited to one

This is easier tbh.

replies.body: I think that its more easy to go a private server to play an scrimm without a team. Or practice yourself to try out on a team.
replies.body_tagged: I think that its more easy to go a private server to play an scrimm without a team. Or practice yourself to try out on a team.

replies.body: There's this, which was made by an OCN player. It works pretty good. You need your own server though.
replies.body_tagged: There's this, which was made by an OCN player. It works pretty good. You need your own server though.

replies.body: Avicus maps are build in YAML,and Cardinal and all OCN stuff uses XML. If u found an YAML to XML converter,say it in the post
replies.body_tagged: Avicus maps are build in YAML,and Cardinal and all OCN stuff uses XML. If u found an YAML to XML converter,say it in the post

replies.body: -1, The dev's have currently enough things to work on + imo Kylo doesn't want to give all the sourcecode he was coding for months away for a scrimmage plugin... Seth (FIyHacks) already gave you a much easier way to practise.
replies.body_tagged: -1, The dev's have currently enough things to work on + imo Kylo doesn't want to give all the sourcecode he was coding for months away for a scrimmage plugin... Seth (FIyHacks) already gave you a much easier way to practise.

replies.body: Or simply use a ocn scrimmage plugin code like Cardinal and turn it to use YAML,its not easy but more effective than release the source code.
replies.body_tagged: Or simply use a ocn scrimmage plugin code like Cardinal and turn it to use YAML,its not easy but more effective than release the source code.

replies.body: Why should Avicus use Cardinal code from other sources and change the code to read yml? It'd even be much easier to just convert the yml files to xml, which is actually the easiest thing for any developers with experience.

replies.body:
I don't see the problem with inviting someone to your team to trial them, playing them, kicking them when you want to decide, and then adding them back or deciding not to add them back...

I don't think we need anything else than what we have now...
replies.body_tagged:
I don't see the problem with inviting someone to your team to trial them, playing them, kicking them when you want to decide, and then adding them back or deciding not to add them back...

I don't think we need anything else than what we have now...

replies.body: What else is needed other than the current system then? What fault does the current scrimmage plugin have?
